title: Act Encounter Codes

publisher: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward
purpose: (Clinical Focus: The purpose of this value set is to represent concepts describing the types of encounter for an encompassing encounter.),(Data Element Scope: ),(Inclusion Criteria: The children of _ActEncounterCode),(Exclusion Criteria: )
steward: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward

title: Act Instance Status
name: ActInstanceStatus
author: FHIMS Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: An implementable instance status; i.e., not abstract),(Data Element Scope: Status values for clinical procedures, observations, statements, orders, referrals, and other acts),(Inclusion Criteria: A concrete status that an act instance can hold),(Exclusion Criteria: Abstract statuses used for semantic grouping)

title: ActPriority
name: ActPriority
author: HL7 US Realm Program Management Author
publisher: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward
purpose: (Clinical Focus: The urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.),(Data Element Scope: ),(Inclusion Criteria: All members of system 2.16.840.1.113883.5.7),(Exclusion Criteria: )
steward: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward

title: ActStatus
name: ActStatus
author: HL7 US Realm Program Management Author
publisher: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Contains the names (codes) for each of the states in the state-machine of the RIM Act class.),(Data Element Scope: status of an act),(Inclusion Criteria: All codes in the HL7 ActStatus code system),(Exclusion Criteria: none)
steward: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward

purpose: (Clinical Focus: ),(Data Element Scope: ),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )

title: Activated partial thromboplastin time
name: ActivatedPartialThromboplastinTime
author: Lantana Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value set identifies the laboratory test activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT).),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify the laboratory test activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). Using the Quality Data Model, this particular element would map to the Laboratory Test category.),(Inclusion Criteria: Include LOINC activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) lab tests using the source of blood, serum or plasma with a reporting scale of seconds.),(Exclusion Criteria: Exclude codes that do not meet the inclusion criteria.)

title: Activated partial thromboplastin time
name: ActivatedPartialThromboplastinTime
author: Lantana Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains lab tests commonly used for a blood, serum or plasma activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) test.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients with a lab test performed on a source of blood, serum or plasma for activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). Using the Quality Data Model, this particular element would map to the Laboratory Test category.),(Inclusion Criteria: Include LOINC activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) lab tests using the source of blood, serum or plasma with a reporting scale of seconds.),(Exclusion Criteria: Exclude codes that do not meet the inclusion criteria.)

title: Activated partial thromboplastin time CPT Code
name: ActivatedPartialThromboplastinTimeCPTCode
author: Cliniwiz Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: ),(Data Element Scope: ),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )

title: Activated partial thromboplastin time CPT Code
name: ActivatedPartialThromboplastinTimeCPTCode
author: Cliniwiz Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: In patients with acute coronary syndromes without ST elevation who are treated with intravenous heparin,  regular APTT monitoring to minimize recurrent ischemic events and bleeding. Chest pain: At many EDs, PT/INR and PTT are a routine part of chest pain orders. However, among these patients, the rate of abnormal coagulation studies is very low, and the results do not alter clinical management),(Data Element Scope: Lab Test documented in a clinical record),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )

title: Activation of Emergency Medical System Education
name: ActivationOfEmergencyMedicalSystemEducation
author: TJC EH Author
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value set contains concepts that represent procedures used to represent patients who receive emergency medical system education.),(Data Element Scope: This value set may use the Quality Data Model (QDM) category related to Communication. The intent of this data element is to identify patients who receive education on the activation of emergency medical system. ),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes only relevant concepts associated with only SNOMED CT codes representing emergency medical system education.),(Exclusion Criteria: No exclusions.)
